column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to write a script. I need to know what network-manager is doing when I click the wifi icon, and click the network that I'm already connected to. Doing so tells network-manager to disconnect then reconnect to the same network.
I connect using the same user that I log into when I boot up.
you know what, I think it's an issue with os x (my client OS), because I can open a terminal in OS X and 'put' just fine. Yet I can't do it using the GUI.
Actually, never mind.  Just install / use proftpd
I dono for sure, (I use proftpd because it is easier), but I think you prolly have to uncomment chroot_local_user=YES and add user name to /etc/vsftpd.chroot_list
